qas.question: What kind of system is Yale's financial aid?
How is most financial aid obtained at Yale?
What was the average need of financial aid at Yale for the Class of 2017?
What percent of students at Yale are thought to have no parental help?
What was the average debt of student loan borrowers from the class of 2013?
What kind of system isn't Yale's financial aid?
How is least financial aid obtained at Yale?
What was the average need of financial aid at Yale for the Class of 2007?
What percent of students at Yale are thought to have all parental help?
What was the average debt of student loan borrowers from the class of 2003?

context: Through its program of <a0_0><b5_0>need-based<b5_0/><a0_0/> financial aid, Yale commits to meet the full demonstrated financial need of all applicants. Most financial aid is in the form of <a1_0><b6_0>grants and scholarships<b6_0/><a1_0/> that do not need to be paid back to the university, and the average need-based aid grant for the Class of 2017 was <a2_0><b7_0>$46,395<b7_0/><a2_0/>. <a3_0><b8_0>15%<b8_0/><a3_0/> of Yale College students are expected to have no parental contribution, and about 50% receive some form of financial aid. About 16% of the Class of 2013 had some form of student loan debt at graduation, with an average debt of <a4_0><b9_0>$13,000<b9_0/><a4_0/> among borrowers.
